title: landsimR
text: Create polygon (patch) landscape using create_landscape()  Add line features landscape add_lines()  Convert landscape LandscapeObj class View LandscapeObj View structure LandscapeObj Use generic plot() function LandscapeObj
code: library(landsimR)  set.seed(1) landscape <- create_landscape(   dim = c(100, 100),   f = c(.05, .05, .05),   q = c(.05, .2, .5) )  colors <- c('green', 'blue', 'orange', 'yellow', 'black', 'brown')  image(landscape, col = colors[1:4]) landscape <- add_lines(   landscape,   f = c(1, .025),   q = c(F, .025),   overlap = c(2, 3) )  image(landscape, col = colors) landscape <- LandscapeObj(   landscape,   classType = c(1,1,1,1,2,3) )  class(landscape) #> [1] "LandscapeObj" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "landsimR" landscape #> LandscapeObj  #>  landscape:  matrix array  dim: 100 100  #>      class:  0 1 2 3 4 5  #>  classType:  1 1 1 1 2 3 str(landscape) #> Formal class 'LandscapeObj' [package "landsimR"] with 3 slots #>   ..@ landscape: num [1:100, 1:100] 5 0 0 2 0 0 0 0 0 0 ... #>   ..@ classes  : chr [1:6] "0" "1" "2" "3" ... #>   ..@ classType: num [1:6] 1 1 1 1 2 3 plot(landscape, col = colors)

title: landsimR
text: Use parameter randomization create random landscape
code: set.seed(0)  random_parameters <- list(   poly = list(   f = c(runif(1, 0.005, .01),         runif(1, .001, .1),         runif(1, .005, .05)         ),   q = c(runif(1, 0, .1),         runif(1, 0.05, .25),         runif(1, 0.5, .9)         )   ),   line = list(     f = c(1, runif(1, .025, .1)),     q = c(F, .05)   ) )  random_landscape <- create_landscape(   dim = c(100, 100),   f = random_parameters$poly$f,   q = random_parameters$poly$q )  random_landscape <- random_landscape |>    add_lines(     random_parameters$line$f,     random_parameters$line$q,     overlap = c(2, 3) )  image(random_landscape, col = colors)

title: landsimR
text: Estimate input parameters random landscape using estimate_parameters() function. first (pink) class estimated_landscape leftover cells  Random parameters estimation Replace leftover cells common value around cell  Side side comparison random estimated
code: estimated_parameters <- estimate_parameters(   landscape = random_landscape,   curve = 5,   line = 4 )  estimated_landscape <- create_landscape(   dim = c(100, 100),   # f = parameters$poly$f[2:4],   # q = parameters$poly$q[2:4]   f = estimated_parameters$poly$f,   q = estimated_parameters$poly$q )   estimated_landscape <- estimated_landscape |>   add_lines(     f = (estimated_parameters$line$f),     q = (estimated_parameters$line$q),     # overlap = c(2, 3)     overlap = c(3, 4) )  # par(mfrow = c(1, 2)) # plot(random_landscape, col = c('green', 'blue', 'orange', 'yellow', 'black', 'brown'), axes = F, main = 'sample landscape')  image(estimated_landscape, col = c('pink', colors)) # library(devtools) # devtools::load_all('~/landsimR/')  estimated_landscape <- estimated_landscape |>   .poly_landscape(c(1:max(estimated_landscape)), not = 5)  image(estimated_landscape, col = colors) par(mfrow = c(1, 2)) image(random_landscape, col = colors, main = 'Random') image(estimated_landscape, col = colors, main = 'Estimated')

title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Last F (2024). landsimR: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://m-kucera.github.io/landsimR/, https://github.com/m-kucera/landsimR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {landsimR: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://m-kucera.github.io/landsimR/},   url = {https://github.com/m-kucera/landsimR}, }

text: short description...

title: construct a landsimR landscape LandscapeObj type — LandscapeObj
construct a landsimR landscape LandscapeObj type — LandscapeObj
text: landscape matrix landscape matrix classType numeric class types: polygon = 1, curve = 2, line = 3

title: construct a landsimR landscape LandscapeObj type — LandscapeObj
text: Landscape landscape object

title: construct a landsimR landscape LandscapeObj type — LandscapeObj
code: LandscapeObj(landscape, c(1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3)) #> LandscapeObj  #>  landscape:  matrix array  dim: 100 100  #>      class:  0 1 2 3 4 5  #>  classType:  1 1 1 1 2 3

what: Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
title: Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
text: description ...

title: Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
text: landscape matrix landscape matrix f vector (length based number desired line classes) frequency given class, q[] = FALSE frequency f[] indicates rate patches connected line features (ordered area descending) q vector (length based number desired line classes) used binning classification q[] = FALSE given class created straight lines overlap vector landscape class overlapped given line class, q[] = FALSE patches given class (overlap[]) connected created line features

title: Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
text: landscape added line features

title: Add Line Features (Classes) to Landscape — add_lines
Create a Virtual Landscape — create_landscape
text: description ...

title: Create a Virtual Landscape — create_landscape
code: create_landscape(dim, f, q, scale = c(res = 1, mmu = 1))

title: Create a Virtual Landscape — create_landscape
text: dim vector (length 2) dimensions landscape f vector (length matching number classes) frequency parameter class used ambient::noise_simplex q vector (length matching number classes) class classification used quantile binning scale vector (length 2) res indicates resolution (size one cell), mmu indicates perspective (thickness smallest line features) !IMPLEMENTED YET!

title: Create a Virtual Landscape — create_landscape
text: matrix integer class values, 1 (n + 1) classes (n length f q vectors) depending input parameters (f q)

title: Estimate Landscape Parameters — estimate_parameters
text: Used get parameters virtual landscape creation functions create_landscape add_lines

title: Estimate Landscape Parameters — estimate_parameters
text: landscape matrix integer values representing different land-cover classes curve list element list contains ) class label b) overlapping (polygon) classes line list element list contains ) class label b) connected (polygon) classes

title: Estimate Landscape Parameters — estimate_parameters
text: estimation parameters given landscape

title: Estimate Landscape Parameters — estimate_parameters
